title: Honoring Doreen Garrett upon the occasion of her designation as recipient of the 2010 Business Person of the Year Award
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION honoring Doreen Garrett upon the occasion of her
designation as recipient of the 2010 Business Person of the  Year  Award
by the Lewis County Chamber of Commerce

WHEREAS,  It  is  incumbent  upon the people of the State of New York to
recognize and acknowledge those within our midst who have  made  signif-
icant contributions to the quality of life therein; and
  WHEREAS, From time to time this Legislative Body takes note of certain
extraordinary  individuals  it  wishes  to  recognize  for  their valued
contributions to the success  and  progress  of  society,  and  publicly
acknowledge their endeavors which have enhanced the basic humanity of us
all; and
  WHEREAS,  Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its long-
standing traditions, this Legislative Body  is  justly  proud  to  honor
Doreen  Garrett upon the occasion of her designation as recipient of the
2010 Business Person of the Year Award by the Lewis  County  Chamber  of
Commerce to be celebrated at a dinner on Thursday, November 18, 2010, at
the Glenfield Fire Hall; and
  WHEREAS, A true entrepreneur, Doreen Garrett not only started a compa-
ny  at  the  young  age of 16, but she had a vision to continuously give
back to both her community and to her employees; and
  WHEREAS, Today, Doreen Garrett is the President  and  Chief  Executive
Officer  (CEO)  of  Otis  Technology,  the cleaning system of choice for
military personnel, law enforcement employees and hunters; and
  WHEREAS, With her focus on sharing her  success  with  others,  Doreen
Garrett is a loving wife, mother, daughter, sister and grandmother; and
  WHEREAS,  Doreen  Garrett  received  her Bachelor's degree in Business
from SUNY Institute of Technology and currently sits on the board of the
Lewis County IDA, Lewis County Hospital Board of Managers, Lewis  County
Economic Development Zone Board, HSBC Central Region Advisory Board, the
board  of  the  New  York State Zoo at Thompson Park, and is a corporate
member of the Association of the United States Army and Young Presidents
Organization; and
  WHEREAS, Doreen Garrett's achievements  are  stellar,  some  of  which
include  the  2002  New York State Senate Woman of Distinction, 2003 DOD
Award for Outstanding Support in Operation Iraqi Freedom, inducted  into
NYS  Small  Business Hall of Fame in 2004, 2004 NYS Small Business Woman
of the Year, 2005 SBA National Award for Outstanding Woman in  Business,
2008 and 2009 Fast Track 50 Business Award for highest growth in Central
New  York,  2009  Ambrose Award winner for support and commitment of the
United States Armed Forces, the 2009 Galanis  Award  for  Excellence  in
Family  Business  and  most recently, the 2010 Progressive Manufacturing
Award for Automated Warehouse and Technology and 2010  DSCC  Gold  Award
for quality performance as a government contractor; and
  WHEREAS,  A  role  model  to  females  in her industry, Doreen Garrett
offers a lot of time speaking to young  professionals  and  women  about
obtaining goals, following your dreams and giving back to the community;
and
  WHEREAS,  With her throughout have been her husband, Jody, and her two
daughters, Ariana and Ondraya, as well as their  granddaughter,  Onnika,
all  of whom feel privileged to be a part of her life and rejoice in her
achievements; and
  WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body that  when  individ-
uals  of  such  noble aims and accomplishments are brought to our atten-
tion, they should be celebrated and recognized by all  the  citizens  of
the great State of New York; now, therefore, be it

  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
honor Doreen Garrett upon the occasion of her designation  as  recipient
of  the 2010 Business Person of the Year Award by the Lewis County Cham-
ber of Commerce; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Doreen Garrett, Turin, New York.
